list_definition.definition: to look, especially quickly and in secret

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: He opened the door slightly and peeked out
Cover your eyes and don’t peek.
Take a peek through the window.

list_ex_of_english: While the experimenter had his or her back towards the children, a hidden camera was there to check if the children had peeked or not.
Bugs hears the commotion, peeks out of his hole and decides to fight the invader.
The innkeeper, captivated by the two, followed them and peeked through the keyhole.
Similarly, the softness of the soundtrack levels forces the listener to get closer to the piece and peek in.
We all of us make mistakes some time, be it the police or people peeking through windows.
The primitive peektoken peeks the top of the input stream without deleting the element.
Although that episode had a subplot involving peeking into the women's bath, the television stations believed it was suitable when reading the script.
